ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would tell anyone who wants to get practical experience and exposure to international relations, policy, and the classics to take it. I would also advise that the seminar setting is beneficial for the design of the course.

Yes! The optimal combination of IR theory and practice. The military fellows, graduate students, guest professors, and constant guest students provided an additional layer of diversity to the coursework.
There are better courses available at Yale than this one.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I was able to read the classics, and apply them in meaningful ways through hands-on projects. For that I am eternally grateful.
This class provided me the theoretical/global framework for my economics senior thesis.
